description: Installation of one internally illuminated fascia sign and one internally illuminated projecting sign.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - No advertisement is to be displayed without the permission of the owner of the site or any other person with an interest in the site entitled to grant permission

Condition : 3 - No advertisement shall be sited or displayed so as to-
(a) endanger persons using any public highway, railway, waterway, dock, harbour or aerodrome (civil or military);
(b) obscure, or hinder the ready interpretation of, any traffic sign, railway signal or aid to navigation by water or air; or
(c) hinder the operation of any device used for the purpose of security or surveillance or for measuring the speed of any vehicle.
Condition : 4 - Any advertisement displayed, and any site used for the display of advertisments, shall be maintained in a condition that does not impair the visual amenity of the site
Condition : 5 - Where an advertisement is required under these Regulations to be removed, the site shall be left in a condition that does not endanger the public or impair visual amenity

Condition : 6 - The external illumination intensity of the front fascia sign and side projecting sign hereby approved shall not exceed 250 candelas per square metre (as measured from any part of the sign).

Condition : 7 - The front fascia sign and side projecting sign hereby approved shall not include moving features, animation, intermittent flashing light sources, changing colours or exposed cold cathode tubing and shall be permanently retained as such.

Condition : 8 - No part of the public footway/ carriageway shall be blocked, and no traffic flow or driver visibility splays shall be obstructed, during the construction or maintenance of the side fascia signs hereby approved.
